correspAction.name: the Horticultural Improvement Association of the Western District

head.supplied: ¶ [The Secretary ¶ The secretary at the time wasSamuelHannaford. ¶ ¶ read a letter from Dr. Mueller, stating that he would have much pleasure in forwarding a supply of seeds from the Botanic Gardens...

div.p: Tothe Horticultural Improvement Association of the Western District

Letter not found. For the text given here, see Transactions of the Horticultural Improvement Association of the Western District (1862), p. 68, read at a meeting of the Association held on 24 April 1861. For another copy, see Victorian Agricultural and
Horticultural Gazette (1861), p. 55.
[The Secretary
The secretary at the time wasSamuelHannaford.
read a letter from Dr. Mueller, stating that he would have much pleasure in forwarding a supply of seeds from the Botanic Gardens, for distribution amongst the Members, more particularly as the Association was established for the promotion of Horticulture; and he trusted that those who shared in this contribution would allow the Botanic Gardens, of which he was Director, to participate in any riches which they might respectively accumulate in their own gardens.]
